Sun.title: SpaceX launches mystery satellite to geostationary transfer orbit (video)
Sun.description: Liftoff of the "Commercial GTO-1" mission occurred at 1:04 a.m. EDT on Sunday morning (July 13).
Sun.author: Mike Wall

Sun.title: Sunspot crackling with magnetic 'bombs' is now turning toward Earth (photo)
Sun.description: Photographer Philippe Tosi captured the remarkable scene unfolding on July 10.
Sun.author: Daisy Dobrijevic

Sun.title: Don't miss the last full 'Manhattanhenge' sunset of 2025 light up NYC today
Sun.description: "July Manhattanhenge is what I call the goodbye to the grid."
Sun.author: Anthony Wood

Mercury.title: February new moon 2025: The young moon occults Mercury and passes by Venus
Mercury.description: On Feb. 28, the one-day-old moon will pass in front of Mercury for observers in Australia and the south Pacific, and on March 1 the moon will make a close pass to Venus.
Mercury.author: Jesse Emspak

Mercury.title: See Mercury at its best in the night sky over the next 2 weeks
Mercury.description: Despite its reputation, Mercury is not really that difficult to spot. But March 2025
Mercury.author: Joe Rao

Mercury.title: Mercury looks stunning in images from BepiColombo spacecraft's 6th and final flyby
Mercury.description: "BepiColombo's main mission phase may only start two years from now, but all six of its flybys of Mercury have given us invaluable new information about the little-explored planet."
Mercury.author: Robert Lea

Venus.title: Venus is at its farthest from the sun on June 1: Here's how to see the bright 'morning star' this weekend
Venus.description: Venus will rise in the eastern sky in the pre-dawn hours of June 1 alongside Saturn and Neptune.
Venus.author: Anthony Wood

Venus.title: Venus, Saturn and the moon dazzle at dawn in 'romantic' photo from Chew Valley Lake (photo)
Venus.description: It was a race against the rising sun as astrophotographer Josh Dury captured a fleeting cosmic moment before dawn’s light washed the scene away.
Venus.author: Daisy Dobrijevic

Venus.title: Curious circles on Venus suggest its surface is still changing
Venus.description: Out of 75 coronae examined, 52 showed signs of these underground forces still at work, hinting that tectonic activity may be more widespread on Venus than previously thought.
Venus.author: Victoria Corless

Earth.title: Private Ax-4 astronauts heading back to Earth early July 14: Watch it live
Earth.description: Undocking from the ISS is expected around 7:05 a.m. ET on Monday (July 14).
Earth.author: Mike Wall

Earth.title: Earth may have at least 6 'minimoons' at any given time. Where do they come from?
Earth.description: "It is incredible that modern telescopic surveys have the ability to detect such small objects up to millions of kilometers away."
Earth.author: Nola Taylor Tillman

Earth.title: Sunspot crackling with magnetic 'bombs' is now turning toward Earth (photo)
Earth.description: Photographer Philippe Tosi captured the remarkable scene unfolding on July 10.
Earth.author: Daisy Dobrijevic

Mars.title: Could NASA's Mars Sample Return be saved? Lockheed Martin proposes $3 billion plan to haul home Red Planet rocks (video)
Mars.description: The aerospace giant says it can revive Mars Sample Return with a leaner, lower-cost approach drawing on proven designs.
Mars.author: Andrew Jones

Mars.title: NASA teaches Mars orbiter to roll over in quest to find Red Planet water
Mars.description: The spacecraft now almost tips upside down relative to Mars to give its radar the best view.
Mars.author: Keith Cooper

Mars.title: Don't miss the crescent moon shining close to Mars on May 31
Mars.description: As the bright star Regulus and the Beehive Cluster shine close by.
Mars.author: Anthony Wood

Saturn.title: These Amazon Prime Day deals must end tonight — don't miss out on big savings across skywatching optics
Saturn.description: It's the last day of Amazon Prime Day and some of these deals are definitely ending tonight. Grab some new optics in time to see Saturn's rings!
Saturn.author: Harry Bennett

Saturn.title: Saturn makes its long-awaited return to the late night sky this week: Here's how to see it
Saturn.description: The ringed giant had previously risen in the early morning and predawn hours as a "morning star."
Saturn.author: Anthony Wood

Saturn.title: The ocean on Saturn's icy moon Enceladus has the right pH for life — barely
Saturn.description: "We know that some microbes on Earth can tolerate the range of pH found on Enceladus."
Saturn.author: Keith Cooper

Uranus.title: Dramatic changes on Uranus, Neptune, Saturn and Jupiter revealed in 10 years of Hubble Telescope images (video)
Uranus.description: The space agency has learned a lot over 10 years observing the weather of our solar system's outer planets.
Uranus.author: Josh Dinner

Uranus.title: 'There are lots of mysteries in our backyard': Revised solar system chemistry explains long-standing puzzles
Uranus.description: "We have been calling Uranus an ice giant, but we don't really know its nature."
Uranus.author: Sharmila Kuthunur

Uranus.title: Icy moon of Uranus may have once hid watery secret, Voyager 2 archives reveal
Uranus.description: "We're squeezing the last bit of science we can from Voyager 2's images."
Uranus.author: Conor Feehly

Neptune.title: Venus is at its farthest from the sun on June 1: Here's how to see the bright 'morning star' this weekend
Neptune.description: Venus will rise in the eastern sky in the pre-dawn hours of June 1 alongside Saturn and Neptune.
Neptune.author: Anthony Wood

Neptune.title: Dramatic changes on Uranus, Neptune, Saturn and Jupiter revealed in 10 years of Hubble Telescope images (video)
Neptune.description: The space agency has learned a lot over 10 years observing the weather of our solar system's outer planets.
Neptune.author: Josh Dinner
